subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... Fair enough.  But why?  :-) I m curious:  what is the advantage of having to recompile your sources whenever you need to run a different set of tests? --
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Jason Rogers

> Alexandru Popescu wrote:
>
> >
> > This is a long-discussion. TestNG is using the suite definition (xml)
> > notion for this. Choosing which tests should be run, is an external
> > concept than the source code.
> >
> Respectfully, that's your opinion. I disagree.

Fair enough. But why? :-)

I'm curious: what is the advantage of having to recompile your sources
whenever you need to run a different set of tests?

--
